about.moreAboutMe1: Masters of Computer Science from Georgia Tech and PSM1 from Scrum.org. Currently working as a full time Software Engineer.
about.moreAboutMe2: I build new projects just to tickle my brain & learn about new technologies.
about.topExpertise: Backend developer who is familiar with Java and Go, as well as Python

project.projectIntro: A functional blogging website build using Django, HTML/CSS with Bootstrap 4.
project.paragraph1: This was a project I build in 2020 when I first learned the basics of programming and web design from Havard's CS50x. This was the project that get me interested in Full Stack Web Development. I build CS50 Blog to mimic the common functionalities that modern blogging and social media webpages can do.
project.paragraph2: User can view the blog posts without creating an account. Creating an account allows users to create their own blog posts, create a customise profile (such as uploading their own profile picture and toggle between light/dark mode), leave like/dislike and comments on other users's blog posts. There is also a password reset option in case users forgets their password.
project.paragraph3: CS50 Blog is currently hosted on Heroku with static files such as profile images of each user is stored in an AWS S3 bucket. Account creation is needed to try the full functionality of CS50 Blog.

project.projectIntro: eCommecre website build using the MERN (MongoDB, Express, React and Node.js) stack.
project.paragraph1: The is project is based on the Udemy course by Brad Traversy - MERN eCommerce From Scratch. This project increased my understanding of using JavaScript frameworks and libraries to build projects and provides a boilerplate for future eCommerce projects using MERN stack.
project.paragraph2: Proshop has full featured shopping cart with PayPal & credit/debit payments; product rating & review system; admin area to manage customers, products & orders; product search, carousel, pagination & more.
project.paragraph3: Proshop is currently hosted on Heroku.

project.projectIntro: An inventory management system build using the Spring Framework, Thymeleaf and Bootstrap.
project.paragraph1: I build the Car Inventory Management System (CIMS) together with my team during my time with NUS ISS. The aim of the project is to build a system that allows Admins to monitor the inventory of car parts easily, and allows the Mechanics to be able to look for the avaliable parts in the store easily for their repairs.
project.paragraph2: Users given Admin rights will have full access to all of CIMS's functionality, which includes but not limited to to add/delete products, restock/withdraw stock count and generate inventory usage reports. Users with Mechanic rights will only be able to withdraw the products needed for their work. Email notification will also be send to the users if they withdraw too much stock and it reaches a reorder level. (Note that the email notification functionality is currently disabled)
project.paragraph3: CIMS is currently hosted on Heroku. Account creation is needed to try the full functionality of CIMS.
